requirement.topic: Synchronous message access with the get() method

description.p: The get() method allows to retrieve messages from xmlBlaster. You can access exactly one message by passing its oid, or a selection of messages by passing an XPATH query.

tr.td: The XML encoded key containing the oid or XPATH query to select messages to get
The XML encoded Quality of Service QoS (see GetQos link below)

description.p: Here is an overview of all available get QoS:
description.pre:
<qos> <!-- Don't return the content data of the message (notify only) --> <content>false</content>
<!-- Filters messages i have subscribed as implemented in the specified plugin --> <!-- Here we use the regex filter and only want contents starting with the letter 'H' --> <filter type='GnuRegexFilter' version='1.0'> ^H.*$ </filter>
<!-- Default is to deliver the current entry (numEntries='1'), '-1' deliver all (default: 1) --> <!-- newestFirst let you change the delivery order, it defaults to true --> <!-- The higher priority messages are always delivered first. --> <!-- In one priority the newest message is delivered first with 'true', setting 'false' --> <!-- reverts the delivery sequence in this priority. --> <history numEntries='20' newestFirst='true'/> </qos>
description.h3: A special note how to use get() in cluster environments:
description.p: If you invoke get() on a cluster slave node, the request is only forwarded to a master node if the key matches the configured master selection.
